comment.text: This translation key is used for the title of a modal dialog that prompts the user to stop filling a form field. It appears on the header of the dialog and is displayed when the "Stop Filling" button is clicked or visible in certain contexts.

usage.context:
visible={visible}
 displayType={ModalDialogType.modal}
 onClose={onClose}
 data-testid="stop-filling-dialog"
 >
 <ModalDialog.Header>{t("Common:StopFillingTitle")}</ModalDialog.Header>
 <ModalDialog.Body>{t("Common:StopFillingBody")}</ModalDialog.Body>
 <ModalDialog.Footer>
 <Button
 id="stop-filling-dialog_submit"
 key="OKButton"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Doldurmaq dayandırılsın?' is a literal translation but doesn't quite capture the conversational tone of 'Stop filling?'. It sounds overly formal. A more natural translation would be something like 'Dayandırılsın?' or 'Saxlanılsın?' depending on context.

The Armenian translation "Դադարե՞լ լրացնելը" (Dadarel lracnely) is a literal translation but doesn't flow naturally in Armenian. It translates to something like 'To stop filling?' rather than the intended 'Stop filling?'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural translation would be something like "Կանգնել լրացնելու՞" (Kangnel lracnelu?) which translates to 'Stop filling?' or simply "Դադարել լրացնելու՞" (Dadarel lracnelu?), but this can also sound slightly unnatural depending on the context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Interrompere la compilazione?" while grammatically correct, is a bit formal for a simple 'Stop filling?' prompt. A more natural and conversational translation would be preferable.
The translation "작성을 중지하시겠습니까?" is overly formal for a simple "Stop filling?" prompt. It translates to 'Would you like to stop writing?' or 'Would you like to cease writing?'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more casual and direct translation like "작성 중지?" or "중지하시겠어요?"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation "ຢຸດຕິມແລ້ວບໍ?" translates more closely to "Have you stopped filling?" or "Did you stop filling?" rather than the English "Stop filling?".  The English phrase is more of a prompt or question seeking confirmation to cease an action.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຢຸດຕິມບໍ? (Yut tim bor?)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation 'Doriți să încetați completarea?' is a very formal and literal translation of 'Stop filling?'. It's unnecessarily verbose for a simple confirmation prompt. A more natural and user-friendly translation would be something like 'Oprești completarea?' or 'Întrerupi completarea?'

The translation 'නොපිරීම නවත්තන්නද?' is a literal translation of 'Stop filling?' but doesn't flow naturally in Sinhala. It can be interpreted as 'Should we stop the filling?' which is not the intended meaning of a simple 'Stop filling?' prompt.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural translation would be 'وقف تعبئة؟' or 'وقف مملوء?' or 'නැවත පිරවීමටද නවත්වන්න?' depending on the precise context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Зауставите попуњавање?" while grammatically correct, doesn't fully capture the nuance of "Stop filling?". It's more literal and sounds slightly awkward. A more natural phrasing in Serbian (Cyrillic) would convey the meaning of stopping a process of filling something out or entering data.

The translation "Doldurma durdurulsun mu?" is a very literal and somewhat unnatural phrasing in Turkish. While technically correct, it doesn't sound conversational. A more natural translation for "Stop filling?" would be something like "Doldurmayı bırak mı?" or "Doldurmayı kes mi?"

The translation '是否停止填写？' is a literal and somewhat formal translation of "Stop filling?". While grammatically correct, it doesn't capture the casual tone of the English phrase. A more natural translation would better reflect the original's conversational style.
